Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Icicle \I"ci*cle\, n. [OE. isikel, AS. [=i]sgicel; [=i]s ice + gicel icicle; akin to Icel. j["o]kull; cf. Gael. eigh ice, Ir. aigh.] A pendent, and usually conical, mass of ice, formed by freezing of dripping water; as, the icicles on the eaves of a house. [1913 Webster]
icicle n : a pendent spear of ice formed by the freezing of dripping water
